DOC.brief_summary: Nut consumption associate reduce risk Type 2 diabetes . The aim study assess effect peanut ( whole peanut butter ) breakfast meal glycemic , insulinemic select gut hormone response , appetite , food intake two consecutive meal obese woman high Type 2 diabetes risk . Fifteen woman participate randomized crossover trial 42.5g whole peanut ( P ) , peanut butter ( PB ) , peanut ( control-C ) add 75g available carbohydrate-matched breakfast meal . Postprandial concentration blood glucose , insulin , non-esterified free fatty acid ( NEFA ) , glucagon-like peptide-1 ( GLP-1 ) , peptide YY ( PYY ) , cholecystokinin ( CCK ) , appetitive sensation food intake assess breakfast treatment standard lunch ( 75g available carbohydrate ) .
DOC.criteria: Body mass index 30 35 kg/M2 Not take medication know affect glycemia , fat metabolism , appetite Regular breakfast consumer ( ≥100 kilocalorie ingest within 2 hour wake ≥4d/wk ) No body weight fluctuation ( < 5kg past 3 month ) Willingness eat test food No selfreported allergy food provide study No selfreported sleep disorder At least one follow condition : waist circumference ≥ 88 cm ; report family history Type 2 diabetes first degree relative ; capillary glycemia 5.5 7.0 mmol/L ; and/or 2hour blood glucose 7.8 11.1 mmol/L ( impaired glucose tolerance ) Type 2 diabetes mellitus Dyslipidemia High blood pressure
